titleStmt.title: James F. Robinson to Abraham Lincoln
CWG7644

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1862-1863

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Executive Department
Frankfort 6 March 1863
His Excellency A. Lincoln

Dear Sir. I have the honor herewith to enclose you an Act of the Legislature of Kentucky expressing its acceptance of the provisions of an Act of the Congress of the United States entitled "An Act donating Public Lands to the Several States and Territories which may provide Colleges for the benefit of Agriculture and the Mechanic Arts" -- Approved July 2d 1862
I request that it may be so disposed of as to secure to my state the benefits of the act
Letter to President Lincoln transmitting Act of Genl Assembly accepting Provisions of an Act of Congress donating Lands &c
